thread.title: NBA GMs pick James as MVP, Okafor top rookie
thread.title_full: NBA GMs pick James as MVP, Okafor top rookie

title: NBA GMs pick James as MVP, Okafor top rookie
text:
NBA GMs pick James as MVP, Okafor top rookie Aldridge picked as most impactful free agent signing By The Sports Xchange Large Text Ezra Shaw/Getty Images 
LeBron James was chosen as Most Valuable Player and the Cleveland Cavaliers were picked as NBA champions in a survey of league general managers released Tuesday. More From KTVZ.COM Eagles have Manning's number, beat... 
NBA.com conducted the survey, in which GMs were forbidden from selecting their own team or personnel. 
LaMarcus Aldridge, who signed a five-year deal with the San Antonio Spurs, was named the most impactful free agent acquisition on 79.3 percent of ballots. 
After James was identified by 50 percent of voters in 2014 as the player they'd choose to start a franchise with, New Orleans Pelicans center Anthony Davis was the overwhelming favorite in that category this year at 86.2 percent. Davis received 25 percent of MVP votes, second to James (39.2). 
Memphis Grizzlies center Marc Gasol (62.1 percent) was voted the NBA's top international player and Philadelphia 76ers center Jahlil Okafor picked as rookie of the year (44.8 percent). However, Minnesota Timberwolves center Karl-Anthony Towns was projected by 62.1 percent to be the best player from this year's rookie class five years from now.
